Posts.Content: On 2/3/2009 rose1325 wrote: I need to select a treat ment for breast cancer stage 4 that spread to the omentum of the peritoneal lining.  My liver and other organs are all right but there is fluid in the abdomen and pelvis.  My doctor stopped arimidex and wants to put me on tamoxafin.  I wondered if there are any other options.   Tahnk you   My wife has the same type rare cancer spread. All imagery tests including PET and CT did not detect it. The only way it was detected was with a lapascopy. Pathology indicated ER+PR- Her2+3 The biopsy is most important to which way to go. Heavy chemo didnt do much. Femara worked for about 5 months and Armidex for about 3 months. She is now on Aromasin. Onc said it was as good as Fasoldex without the injection. We are hoping it will work. How was you spread detected?
Posts.Title: Any information on peritoneal breast cancer spread?

Posts.Content: If you have er+, an aramotase inhibitor like Femara, Armidex, Aromasin or Faslodex might work for a while. Each have their side effects. In my wifes case she had two chemos and herceptin for six months, but the CA27.29 marker stayed about the same (above normal range). When she tried Femara the marker when down for about 5 months. We are looking for more info on HIPEC. So far the HIPEC literature doesnt list breast cancer, but may be because its such a rare metastatis that there are very few cases. You may want to check out:  http://www.nypsystem.org/press/2009/01/stamford-hospital-int
Posts.Title: Any information on peritoneal breast cancer spread?

Posts.Content: On 2/24/2009 survivorchic wrote:   On 2/4/2009 Scrunch wrote:   On 2/3/2009 rose1325 wrote: I need to select a treat ment for breast cancer stage 4 that spread to the omentum of the peritoneal lining.  My liver and other organs are all right but there is fluid in the abdomen and pelvis.  My doctor stopped arimidex and wants to put me on tamoxafin.  I wondered if there are any other options.   Tahnk you Hello Rose, I had breast cancer in 2001 and last July was diagnosed with Stage IV Peritoneal Carcinomatosis, which was traced to the breast cancer.  So far, it hasn't penetrated any internal organs, but it did crowd many of them.  My kidneys were swollen and the ureters were crimped, so they put stents in both ureters.  But to get to the point, I was first put on Arimidex, which didn't work.  Now they have me on Taxol infusions, which are working.  My tumor markers (last time they checked) have come down to 39, which is nearly normal.  I have 3 more infusions, and then they are going to do scans to see what is going on.  I so seldom hear about anybody else who has this that I had to contact you and commiserate about the situation.  I keep worrying about when it might penetrate any of the internal organs, especially the colon, because I don't want peritonitis.  Feel free to contact me any time to discuss our common condition.  Best wishes, Carolyn             Hi Carolyn & others, I am just 42 and have breast cancer for the 2nd time- I have exactly the same situation as you Carolyn as this time it has spread to my lymphnodes in my abdomen & had kidney issues & had 2 stents put in. I was given 3 sessions of Taxitere, had a scan last week & it's not working. My onc has switched me to Taxol & Gemzar, started that last Friday-had a very rough week last week after all this news. I had cancer 3 years ago & thought I was doing great. My husband left 2 years ago cuz he couldn't handle it & sometimes I feel very alone although I have great friends & family. I stumbled upon this site & hope it will help with suggestions & coping. I can't take any hormones, as I am er-hr-. I am going to try some alternative medicines & am radically trying to change my diet-NO SUGAR! anyway-love to hear from anyone who can perk me up! Thanks Linda    My wife has been Dx with this rare metastis to the peritoneal about a year and a half ago. She has been through multiple aromatase inhibitor drugs but none are currently working. This is her second recurrence since her first bout in 1990. The onc is trying to get her started on Tykerb. Could you let us know what treatments you have had and how you are currently doing? Thanks
Posts.Title: Any information on peritoneal breast cancer spread?

Posts.Content: My wife also had a PET scan a while back, but it didnt show any cancer. She also has had a number of CT scans, with nothing showing. The lapascopy was only way it was detected. The type is lobular, not ductal. Currently there is a lot of fluid buildup in the abdomin, and the CA27.29 marker is above 100.  We are hoping Aromasin will work, but if it doesnt, the Onc has mentioned Tykerb (chemo). We are wondering if she might be a canidate for the HIPEC procedure.
Posts.Title: Any information on peritoneal breast cancer spread?

Posts.Content: My wife also had a PET scan a while back, but it didnt show any cancer. She also has had a number of CT scans, with nothing showing. The lapascopy was only way it was detected. The type is lobular, not ductal. Currently there is a lot of fluid buildup in the abdomin, and the CA27.29 marker is above 100.  We are hoping Aromasin will work, but if it doesnt, the Onc has mentioned Tykerb (chemo). We are wondering if she might be a canidate for the HIPEC procedure.
Posts.Title: Any information on peritoneal breast cancer spread?

Posts.Content: Rose, I found a little more info in HIPEC. Even though its not written up for breast cancer, it might be worth checking out. There are about 50 surgeons in US that do the procedure. The one I checked on is at the website (Atlanta): www.drqmd.com  Have you started on the new treatment?
Posts.Title: Any information on peritoneal breast cancer spread?

Posts.Content: If you have er+, an aramotase inhibitor like Femara, Armidex, Aromasin or Faslodex might work for a while. Each have their side effects. In my wifes case she had two chemos and herceptin for six months, but the CA27.29 marker stayed about the same (above normal range). When she tried Femara the marker when down for about 5 months. We are looking for more info on HIPEC. So far the HIPEC literature doesnt list breast cancer, but may be because its such a rare metastatis that there are very few cases. You may want to check out:  http://www.nypsystem.org/press/2009/01/stamford-hospital-int
Posts.Title: Any information on peritoneal breast cancer spread?

Posts.Content: On 2/19/2009 rose1325 wrote: Hi, Thanks for the info.  I had a pet scan and there are a lot of masses.  My doctor doesn't want to do a biopsy.  She "sure" its br er+.  I am going for a second opinion because cancer can change from positive to negative when it mets.  I want a biopsy.    There is an operation called HIPEC done for pertineal cancer but not for breast cancer peritoneal spread.  The results are fairly good. I know radio wave therapy is being used in Germany.  I am trying to avoid chemo because it didn't work very well and the side effects were horrific.  But I am afraid it will end up as my choice. Thank you for writing.  I learn a little more every day.  People are so kind to share their experiences.  It does help.   Hope you wife is doing well.  Rose   I found another person (Melissa) with the same dx: http://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/454353
Posts.Title: Any information on peritoneal breast cancer spread?
